Description: Copper alloy pentagonal plaque, cast and with relief decoration. At the centre is the draped bust of Dionysus. On his proper right is Hermes with Caduceus and money-bag. and on his proper left is the eagle of Zeus, perched on a thunderbolt. On either side of Dionysus' head are stars representing the Dioscouri (Castor and Pollux). Dionysus' head has been deliberately defaced.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (MB.277)
Acquisition notes: Acquired throught the departmental purchase grant. Said to be from an old European collection.
